intro: Alpinia roscoeana, commonly known as the fragrant ginger or mountain ginger, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other well-known gingers such as turmeric and cardamom. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to white flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Botanically, it is characterized by its aromatic oils and distinctive floral structure.
